title: Disconnecting even when i have a wifi connection?
body: So, i was recently in a game, i was 20/9/11 as kindred, i was carrying, but we were struggling to keep turrets safe when all of a sudden, i disconnected, upon checking my wifi connection, i saw i was connected, but it wouldn't reconnect, any ways to fix this?

replies.body: Wireless is always much less stable than a wired ethernet connection. Riot has advised people to use wired connections whenever possible, as this is reduce disconnects and high latency in a majority of cases. Wireless transmits data through the air, which any form of matter can interfere, and cause spikes (loss of packets) and for that split moment you have, according to the game servers, no internet. The more dropped, the harder the DC/latency

*Der* is 100% spot on with their assessment! WiFi is super convenient, but it may actually be contributing to your issues at the moment. I strongly recommend working through our [**connection guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) in its entirety, as those steps commonly resolve these sorts of issues.

Please let me know if this ended up resolving your problems.

Thanks for confirming. I'd recommend trying to launch League from the **lol.launcher.admin.exe** file within your installation folder (C:\Riot Games\League of Legends) by right-clicking on the shortcut and selecting *run as administrator*.

I hope this helped get you back into the Legacy Client.
